column4: so i have a working windows install, is there a way to boot it directly without using ntldr from grub?
You mean without using the Grub menu.......or?
Pastebin your menu.lst and we can try to help you clean it up. After that, if you still want Windows to be the default, there are a couple ways to do that.
Well, the file is fine. Since this happened due to a corrupt ntldr, if you've got a Windows disk, I'd use the recovery console to issue fixmbr and fixboot.
